Short Description:
Sygen Pharmaceuticals Ltd is a Nigerian life sciences company founded in March 2019. It focuses on the development, manufacturing, and distribution of branded generic pharmaceuticals, primarily serving the West African region. The company aims to improve access to high-quality medicines and enhance patient outcomes. In December 2019, Sygen acquired the assets and legacy brands of Nigerian German Chemicals PLC, which has a long-standing presence in Nigeria.

Sygen manufactures over 16 categories of branded generic pharmaceuticals, including both over-the-counter and prescription medications. Its product range covers various therapeutic areas such as antidiabetics, analgesics, antifungals, and multivitamins. The company operates ISO- and NAFDAC-approved manufacturing facilities and emphasizes innovation and compliance with regulatory standards. Sygen is committed to fostering community well-being and improving healthcare outcomes in Nigeria and the surrounding region.

Short Description: Kwara Chemical Company (KCC) is a pharmaceutical manufacturing company dedicated to delivering high quality healthcare products for both human and veterinary use. Founded in 1995, the company has built a strong reputation in the industry for its customer relationship management and values driven operation.

Nigerian-German Chemicals Plc ("NGC") is a leading manufacturer and distributor of beverages and pharmaceutical products.  The company was founded in 1964 as Hoechst Nigeria Limited.  NGC is listed on the Nigerian Stock Exchange and has over 400 employees.  The company's headquarters are located in Otta-Sango, Ogun State.  Besides its headquarters, NGC has nine additional depots and offices located across Nigeria. 

In its pharmaceutical segment, NGC focuses on diabetic treatment (Glanil and Gluformin), cough syrups, ibuprofen and paracetamol based pain medication (Daga, NGC-Valgin, and Tabalon), and multivitamins.  Through its beverage segment, NGC produces and sells Sparwasser Still Water, Vimto, Sparwasser Apple, and Sparwasser Lime 'n Lemon.

Kunle Ara Pharmacy Limited is a major retail and wholesale pharmaceutical company engaged in the sourcing and distribution of medical and pharmaceutical products in Nigeria. The Company since incorporation in 1995 started its retail and distribution business in Maiduguri, Borno State (North-Eastern Nigeria), and has grown to be a leading pharmacy in Nigeria.

Currently located opposite Nigeria's foremost and biggest hospital, University College Hospital, Ibadan,(South Western Nigeria), Kunle Ara Pharmacy is poised to provide a broad range of pharmaceutical services at the lowest possible price to diverse customers from Nigeria and indeed, the West African sub region.

Short Description:
Qualex Global Limited (QG) group was founded with a focus on providing solutions and support to individuals and organisations in general but particularly to practitioners and stakeholders (employees, manufacturers, employers/owners, regulators, consumers/patients) in the Food, Pharmaceutical and Cosmetics industries in the areas of Regulatory Compliance, current Good Manufacturing Practice, Good Distribution Practice, Process Management, Incident Management and Quality Management Systems. Our clientele also includes the organisations that provide inputs and other services to our target industries such as packaging components, raw materials and excipients suppliers, logistics providers, warehouses, depots, wholesalers and distributors. 
Our primary area of operation is the West Africa sub-region emerging market.
Our approach is to apply systematic diagnostic methodology to understand the possible root causes of every situation or incident and then scientifically determine the best and most cost effective solution; we also partner with our clients to implement the solution. Our motto is â€˜Continuous Improvement'.

Keywords: pharmaceutical waste management, pharmaceutical manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, medical
Short Description:
PharmaBin is an initiative dedicated to solving the pressing issue of pharmaceutical waste management in Nigeria. By integrating technology, community engagement, and environmental sustainability, PharmaBin provides a safe, efficient, and eco-friendly solution for the disposal of expired, unused, or contaminated medications.

Our platform connects households, community pharmacies, and regulatory bodies, ensuring proper collection and disposal of pharmaceutical waste while raising awareness about its impact on health and the environment. With a vision to lead responsible waste management practices in Nigeria, PharmaBin is committed to fostering a cleaner, healthier, and more sustainable future.

Join us on this journey to protect our planet and promote public health.
